story_hud.title: The Story of Prophet Hud (as)
story_hud.subtitle: A warning to a mighty nation that forgot Allah
story_hud.cardPreview: A prophet sent to a strong and proud people who built great structures but disobeyed Allah, until a fierce wind destroyed them.
story_hud.body:
Prophet Hud (peace be upon him) was sent to the people of โAd. They were a very strong and powerful nation. They built tall pillars and impressive buildings in the region of Al-Ahqaf and were proud of their strength. Instead of being grateful to Allah, they became arrogant. They worshipped idols, oppressed others, and believed that no one could defeat them.

Allah sent Hud (as) to guide them. He was from among them, spoke their language, and cared deeply for them. He called them to worship Allah alone, to stop worshipping idols, and to fear Allah who had given them everything they possessed. He reminded them that their strength and beautiful homes were gifts from Allah, not reasons for pride or injustice.

Hud (as) told them that if they believed and obeyed Allah, He would increase them in blessings. But if they continued in arrogance and disbelief, punishment would come. The leaders of โAd mocked him. They said things like, โWho is stronger than us?โ and accused Hud (as) of foolishness. They refused to give up their pride and idols.

Hud (as) remained patient. He made it clear that he did not ask them for any reward and that his reward was only with Allah. He warned them again and again over many years. Only a small group believed in him and followed his message.

When the people completely refused to listen, Allahโs punishment began. First, their land became dry. Rain stopped, and the people of โAd hoped for clouds to bring rain. One day they saw a huge dark cloud approaching and felt happy, thinking it would bring water. But that cloud carried a violent, freezing wind. The wind blew with great force for many days, destroying their homes and throwing their bodies to the ground. The mighty nation of โAd, which thought it could never be defeated, was wiped out. Only Hud (as) and the believers with him were saved.

Allah mentions the people of โAd in the Qurโan as a warning to others: power and wealth do not protect you if you are arrogant and disobedient. True safety lies in obeying Allah and remaining humble.

From the story of Prophet Hud (as), we learn not to be proud of our strength, our homes, or our achievements. Everything we have is a gift from Allah, and He can take it away whenever He wills. We also learn to remain patient like Hud (as) when others reject the truth, and to remember that true honor comes from obeying Allah, not from impressing people.

q1.question: To which nation was Prophet Hud (as) sent?

q2.question: What were the people of โAd best known for?

q3.question: What was the main message Prophet Hud (as) gave to his people?
q3.o2: To worship Allah alone and stop worshipping idols

q4.question: How did many leaders of โAd respond to Hud (as)?
q4.o1: They welcomed him and believed immediately
q4.o2: They became afraid and left the city
q4.o3: They mocked him and called him foolish

q5.question: What did Hud (as) say about the blessings the people had?
q5.o1: That they earned everything by themselves
q5.o3: That they were gifts from Allah meant to inspire gratitude
q5.o4: That they did not deserve any blessings

q6.question: What happened in the land of โAd before the punishment came?
q6.o3: The land became dry and they hoped for rain
q6.o4: A great fire came down from the sky

q7.question: What was inside the dark cloud that the people of โAd thought would bring rain?
q7.o3: A violent, freezing wind that destroyed them

q8.question: What happened to Prophet Hud (as) and the believers when the punishment came?
q8.o1: They were destroyed along with the others
q8.o4: They were lifted into the sky

q9.question: What important lesson do we learn from the story of Hud (as) and the people of โAd?
q9.o1: That being strong means you will never be punished
q9.o2: That wealth and power can replace obedience to Allah
q9.o3: That arrogance and idol worship can destroy a nation
q9.o4: That prophets should not warn their people

q10.question: What is a good way to act according to the story of Hud (as)?
q10.o1: To be proud and show off strength
q10.o2: To think you are better than others
q10.o3: To be humble, thank Allah for His blessings, and obey Him
q10.o4: To ignore all warnings and do whatever you want
